abort_index_segment_size.description: Capacity (in number of txns) of an abort index segment
abort_index_segment_size.name: abort_index_segment_size

abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms.description: How often look for the inactive transactions and abort them
abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms.name: abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms

admin.description: Address and port of admin server
admin.name: admin

admin_api_require_auth.description: Whether admin API clients must provide HTTP Basic authentication headers
admin_api_require_auth.name: admin_api_require_auth

admin_api_tls.description: TLS configuration for admin HTTP server
admin_api_tls.name: admin_api_tls

advertised_pandaproxy_api.description: Rest API address and port to publish to client
advertised_pandaproxy_api.name: advertised_pandaproxy_api

aggregate_metrics.description: Enable aggregations of metrics returned by the prometheus '/metrics' endpoint. Metric aggregation is performed by summing the values of samples by labels. Aggregations are performed where it makes sense by the shard and/or partition labels.
aggregate_metrics.name: aggregate_metrics

alive_timeout_ms.description: Time from the last node status heartbeat after which a node will be considered offline and not alive
alive_timeout_ms.name: alive_timeout_ms

alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms.description: Time to wait for entries replication in controller log when executing alter configuration request
alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms.name: alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms

append_chunk_size.description: Size of direct write operations to disk in bytes
append_chunk_size.name: append_chunk_size

audit_client_max_buffer_size.description: Maximum number of bytes the internal audit client will allocate for audit log records. Disable and re-enable auditing for changes to take affect
audit_client_max_buffer_size.name: audit_client_max_buffer_size

audit_enabled_event_types.description: List of event classes that will be audited, options are: [management, produce, consume, describe, heartbeat, authenticate, admin, schema_registry]. Please refer to the documentation to know exactly which request(s) map to a particular audit event type.
audit_enabled_event_types.name: audit_enabled_event_types

audit_excluded_principals.description: List of user principals to exclude from auditing
audit_excluded_principals.name: audit_excluded_principals

audit_excluded_topics.description: List of topics to exclude from auditing
audit_excluded_topics.name: audit_excluded_topics

audit_log_num_partitions.description: Number of partitions for the internal audit log topic. Attempt to create topic is only performed if it doesn't already exist, disable and re-enable auditing for changes to take affect
audit_log_num_partitions.name: audit_log_num_partitions

audit_log_replication_factor.description: Replication factor of the internal audit log topic. Attempt to create topic is only performed if it doesn't already exist, disable and re-enable auditing for changes to take affect.  If unset, defaults to `default_topic_replication`
audit_log_replication_factor.name: audit_log_replication_factor

audit_queue_drain_interval_ms.description: Frequency in which per shard audit logs are batched to client for write to audit log. Longer intervals allow for greater change for coalescing duplicates (great for high throughput auditing scenarios) but increase the risk of data loss during hard shutdowns.
audit_queue_drain_interval_ms.name: audit_queue_drain_interval_ms

audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard.description: Maximum amount of memory allowed in the audit buffer per shard Once this value is reached, any request handlers that cannot enqueue audit messages will return a non retryable error to the client. Note that this only will occur when handling requests that are currently enabled for auditing.
audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard.name: audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard

brokers.description: List of address and port of the brokers
brokers.name: brokers

client_cache_max_size.description: The maximum number of kafka clients in the LRU cache
client_cache_max_size.name: client_cache_max_size

client_identifier.description: Identifier to use within the kafka request header
client_identifier.name: client_identifier

client_keep_alive.description: Time in milliseconds that an idle connection may remain open
client_keep_alive.name: client_keep_alive

cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on.description: If set to `true`, when a cluster is started for the first time and there is cluster metadata in the configured cloud storage bucket, Redpanda automatically starts a cluster restore from that metadata. If using an automated method for deployment where it's not easy to predictably determine that a restore is needed, we recommend setting to `true`. Take care to ensure that in such deployments, a cluster bootstrap with a given bucket means that any previous cluster using that bucket is fully destroyed; otherwise tiered storage subsystems may interfere with each other.
cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on.name: cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on_bootstrap

cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint.description: Azure Data Lake Storage v2 endpoint override. Use when Hierarchical Namespaces are enabled on your storage account and you have set up a custom endpoint.
cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint.name: cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint

cloud_storage_azure_adls_port.description: Azure Data Lake Storage v2 port override. Also see cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint.
cloud_storage_azure_adls_port.name: cloud_storage_azure_adls_port

cloud_storage_azure_container.description: The name of the Azure container to use with Tiered Storage. Note that the container must belong to 'cloud_storage_azure_storage_account'
cloud_storage_azure_container.name: cloud_storage_azure_container

cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespa.description: Whether or not Azure Hierarchical Namespaces are enabled on the cloud_storage_azure_storage_account. If this property is not set, cloud_storage_azure_shared_key must be set, and each node will try to determine at startup if HNS is enabled. Setting this property to True will disable the check and assume HNS is active. Setting to False will disable the check and assume that HNS is not active.
cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespa.name: cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespace_enabled

cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id.description: The managed identity ID to use with Azure Managed Identities. This takes affect when the cloud_storage_credential_source configuration option is set to azure_vm_instance_metadata.
cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id.name: cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id

cloud_storage_azure_shared_key.description: The shared key to be used for Azure Shared Key authentication with the configured Azure storage account (see 'cloud_storage_azure_storage_account)'. Note that Redpanda expects this string to be Base64 encoded.
cloud_storage_azure_shared_key.name: cloud_storage_azure_shared_key

cloud_storage_azure_storage_account.description: The name of the Azure storage account to use with Tiered Storage
cloud_storage_azure_storage_account.name: cloud_storage_azure_storage_account

cloud_storage_backend.description: Optional cloud storage backend variant used to select API capabilities. If not supplied, will be inferred from other configuration parameters.
cloud_storage_backend.name: cloud_storage_backend

cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota.description: The number of total requests that the cloud storage background jobs are allowed to make during one background housekeeping run. This is a per shard limit.
cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota.name: cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota

cloud_storage_bucket.description: AWS bucket that should be used to store data
cloud_storage_bucket.name: cloud_storage_bucket

cloud_storage_cache_check_interval_ms.description: Minimum time between trims of tiered storage cache.  If a fetch operation requires trimming the cache, and the most recent trim was within this period, then trimming will be delayed until this period has elapsed
cloud_storage_cache_check_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_cache_check_interval

cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size.description: Size of chunks of segments downloaded into cloud storage cache. Reduces space usage by only downloading the necessary chunk from a segment.
cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size.name: cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size

cloud_storage_cache_directory.description: Directory for archival cache. Should be present when `cloud_storage_enabled` is present
cloud_storage_cache_directory.name: cloud_storage_cache_directory

cloud_storage_cache_max_objects.description: Maximum number of objects that may be held in the tiered storage cache.  This applies simultaneously with `cloud_storage_cache_size`, and which ever limit is hit first will drive trimming of the cache.
cloud_storage_cache_max_objects.name: cloud_storage_cache_max_objects

cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets.description: Divide cloud storage cache across specified number of buckets. This only works for objects with randomized prefixes. The names will not be changed if the value is set to zero.
cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets.name: cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets

cloud_storage_cache_size_percent.description: The maximum size of the archival cache as a percentage of unreserved disk space (see disk_reservation_percent). The default value for this option is tuned for a shared disk configuration. When using a dedicated cache disk consider increasing the value.
cloud_storage_cache_size_percent.name: cloud_storage_cache_size_percent

cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes.description: The cache performs a recursive directory inspection during the cache trim. The information obtained during the inspection can be carried over to the next trim operation. This parameter sets a limit on the memory occupied by objects that can be carried over from one trim to next, and allows cache to quickly unblock readers before starting the directory inspection.
cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes.name: cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes

cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy.description: Selects a strategy for evicting unused cache chunks.
cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy.name: cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy

cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch.description: Number of chunks to prefetch ahead of every downloaded chunk
cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch.name: cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consu.description: Number of groups to upload in a single snapshot object during consumer offsets upload. Setting a lower value will mean a larger number of smaller snapshots are uploaded.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consu.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consumer_groups_per_upload

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries.description: Number of attempts metadata operations may be retried.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_in.description: Time interval to wait between cluster metadata uploads.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_in.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_interval_ms

cloud_storage_credentials_host.description: The hostname to connect to for retrieving role based credentials. Derived from cloud_storage_credentials_source if not set. Only required when using IAM role based access.
cloud_storage_credentials_host.name: cloud_storage_credentials_host

cloud_storage_credentials_source.description: The source of credentials to connect to cloud services
cloud_storage_credentials_source.name: cloud_storage_credentials_source

cloud_storage_crl_file.description: Path to certificate revocation list for cloud_storage_trust_file.
cloud_storage_crl_file.name: cloud_storage_crl_file

cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager.description: Use legacy upload mode and do not start archiver_manager.
cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager.name: cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager

cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads.description: Disable chunk reads and switch back to legacy mode where full segments are downloaded.
cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads.name: cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads

cloud_storage_disable_metadata_consisten.description: Disable all metadata consistency checks. This will allow redpanda to replay logs with inconsistent tiered-storage metadata. Normally, this option should be disabled.
cloud_storage_disable_metadata_consisten.name: cloud_storage_disable_metadata_consistency_checks

cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_.description: Begins the read replica sync loop in tiered-storage-enabled topic partitions. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_.name: cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_for_tests

cloud_storage_disable_tls.description: Disable TLS for all S3 connections
cloud_storage_disable_tls.name: cloud_storage_disable_tls

cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency.description: Disable all upload consistency checks. This will allow redpanda to upload logs with gaps and replicate metadata with consistency violations. Normally, this options should be disabled.
cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency.name: cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency_checks

cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_te.description: Begins the upload loop in tiered-storage-enabled topic partitions. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_te.name: cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_tests

cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reu.description: Enable re-uploading data for compacted topics
cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reu.name: cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reupload

cloud_storage_enable_remote_read.description: Default remote read config value for new topics
cloud_storage_enable_remote_read.name: cloud_storage_enable_remote_read

cloud_storage_enable_remote_write.description: Default remote write value for new topics
cloud_storage_enable_remote_write.name: cloud_storage_enable_remote_write

cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing.description: Enable scrubbing of cloud storage partitions. The scrubber validates the integrity of data and metadata uploaded to cloud storage
cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing.name: cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing

cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging.description: Enables adjacent segment merging. The segments are reuploaded if there is an opportunity for that and if it will improve the tiered-storage performance
cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging.name: cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging

cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms.description: Time interval between a final scrub and thte next scrub
cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms

cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for running the cloud storage garbage collection (ms)
cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_.description: Time limit on waiting for uploads to complete before a leadership transfer.  If this is null, leadership transfers will proceed without waiting.
cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_.name: cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms.description: Interval for cloud storage housekeeping tasks
cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms

cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segmen.description: The maximum number of chunks per segment that can be hydrated at a time. Above this number, unused chunks will be trimmed.
cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segmen.name: cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segment_ratio

cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms.description: Duration to wait for a hydration request to be fulfilled, if hydration is not completed within this time, the consumer will be notified with a timeout error.
cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps.description: The cloud storage request rate threshold for idle state detection. If the average request rate for the configured period is lower than this threshold the cloud storage is considered being idle.
cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps.name: cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps

cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms.description: Timeout used to detect idle state of the cloud storage API. If the average cloud storage request rate is below this threshold for a configured amount of time the cloud storage is considered idle and the housekeeping jobs are started.
cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms.description: Initial backoff time for exponential backoff algorithm (ms)
cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms.name: cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size.description: Amount of memory that can be used to handle tiered-storage metadata
cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size.name: cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size

cloud_storage_manifest_cache_ttl_ms.description: The time interval that determines how long the materialized manifest can stay in cache under contention. This parameter is used for performance tuning. When the spillover manifest is materialized and stored in cache and the cache needs to evict it it will use 'cloud_storage_materialized_manifest_ttl_ms' value as a timeout. The cursor that uses the spillover manifest uses this value as a TTL interval after which it stops referencing the manifest making it available for eviction. This only affects spillover manifests under contention.
cloud_storage_manifest_cache_ttl_ms.name: cloud_storage_materialized_manifest_ttl_ms

cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interv.description: Wait at least this long between partition manifest uploads. Actual time between uploads may be greater than this interval. If this is null, metadata will be updated after each segment upload.
cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interv.name: cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interval_sec

cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_.description: Maximum concurrent segment hydrations of remote data per CPU core.  If unset, value of `cloud_storage_max_connections / 2` is used, which means that half of available S3 bandwidth could be used to download data from S3. If the cloud storage cache is empty every new segment reader will require a download. This will lead to 1:1 mapping between number of partitions scanned by the fetch request and number of parallel downloads. If this value is too large the downloads can affect other workloads. In case of any problem caused by the tiered-storage reads this value can be lowered. This will only affect segment hydrations (downloads) but won't affect cached segments. If fetch request is reading from the tiered-storage cache its concurrency will only be limited by available memory.
cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_.name: cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_connections.description: Max number of simultaneous connections to S3 per shard (includes connections used for both uploads and downloads)
cloud_storage_max_connections.name: cloud_storage_max_connections

cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_.description: Maximum concurrent readers of remote data per CPU core.  If unset, value of `topic_partitions_per_shard` multiplied by 2 is used.
cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_.name: cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_sh.description: Maximum concurrent I/O cursors of materialized remote segments per CPU core.  If unset, value of `topic_partitions_per_shard` is used, i.e. one segment reader per partition if the shard is at its maximum partition capacity.  These readers are cachedacross Kafka consume requests and store a readahead buffer.
cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_sh.name: cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_delet.description: The per-partition limit for the number of segments pending deletion from the cloud. Segments can be deleted due to retention or compaction. If this limit is breached and deletion fails, then segments will be orphaned in the cloud and will have to be removed manually
cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_delet.name: cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_deletion_per_partition

cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard.description: Max throughput used by tiered-storage per shard in bytes per second. This value is an upper bound of the throughput available to the tiered-storage subsystem. This parameter is intended to be used as a safeguard and in tests when we need to set precise throughput value independent of actual storage media. Please use 'cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent' instead of this parameter in the production environment.
cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard.name: cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard

cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_thr.description: The minimum number of chunks per segment for trimming to be enabled. If the number of chunks in a segment is below this threshold, the segment is small enough that all chunks in it can be hydrated at any given time
cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_thr.name: cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_threshold

cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms.description: Time interval between two partial scrubs of the same partition
cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms

cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_.description: Timeout to check if new data is available for partition in S3 for read replica
cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_.name: cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retenti.description: Retention in bytes for topics created during automated recovery
cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retenti.name: cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retention_bytes_default

cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.description: Number of segment metadata to validate, from newest to oldest, when `cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_mode` is `check_manifest_and_segment_metadata`
cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.name: cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_depth

cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.description: Validation mode performed before recovering a topic from cloud storage
cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.name: cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_mode

cloud_storage_region.description: AWS region that houses the bucket used for storage
cloud_storage_region.name: cloud_storage_region

cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for IAM role related operations (ms)
cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_.description: Jitter applied to the cloud storage scrubbing interval.
cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_.name: cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_ms

cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interva.description: Time that segment can be kept locally without uploading it to the remote storage (sec)
cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interva.name: cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interval_sec

cloud_storage_segment_size_min.description: Smallest acceptable segment size in the cloud storage. Default: cloud_storage_segment_size_target/2
cloud_storage_segment_size_min.name: cloud_storage_segment_size_min

cloud_storage_segment_size_target.description: Desired segment size in the cloud storage. Default: segment.bytes
cloud_storage_segment_size_target.name: cloud_storage_segment_size_target

cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_seg.description: Maximum number of elements in the spillover manifest that can be offloaded to the cloud storage. This property is similar to 'cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size' but it triggers spillover based on number of segments instead of the size of the manifest in bytes. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in the production environment
cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_seg.name: cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_segments

cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size.description: The size of the manifest which can be offloaded to the cloud. If the size of the local manifest stored in redpanda exceeds cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size x2 the spillover mechanism will split the manifest into two parts and one of them will be uploaded to S3.
cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size.name: cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size

cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent.description: Max throughput used by tiered-storage per node expressed as a percentage of the disk bandwidth. If the server has several disks Redpanda will take into account only the one which is used to store tiered-storage cache. Note that even if the tiered-storage is allowed to use full bandwidth of the disk (100%) it won't necessary use it in full. The actual usage depend on your workload and the state of the tiered-storage cache. This parameter is a safeguard that prevents tiered-storage from using too many system resources and not a performance tuning knob.
cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent.name: cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent

cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_m.description: Grace period during which the purger will refuse to purge the topic.
cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_m.name: cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_ms

cloud_storage_trust_file.description: Path to certificate that should be used to validate server certificate during TLS handshake
cloud_storage_trust_file.name: cloud_storage_trust_file

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff.description: derivative coefficient for upload PID controller.
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares.description: maximum number of IO and CPU shares that archival upload can use
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares.description: minimum number of IO and CPU shares that archival upload can use
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff.description: proportional coefficient for upload PID controller
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff

cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backof.description: Initial backoff interval when there is nothing to upload for a partition (ms)
cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backof.name: cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms.description: Max backoff interval when there is nothing to upload for a partition (ms)
cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms.name: cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_url_style.description: Specifies the addressing style to use for Amazon S3 requests. This configuration determines how S3 bucket URLs are formatted. You can choose between: `virtual_host`, (e.g. `<bucket-name>.s3.amazonaws.com`), `path`, (e.g. `s3.amazonaws.com/<bucket-name>`), and `null`. Path style is supported for backward compatibility with legacy systems. When this property is not set (`null`), the client tries to use `virtual_host` addressing. If the initial request fails, the client automatically tries the `path` style. If neither addressing style works, Redpanda terminates the startup, requiring manual configuration to proceed.
cloud_storage_url_style.name: cloud_storage_url_style

compacted_log_segment_size.description: How large in bytes should each compacted log segment be (default 256MiB)
compacted_log_segment_size.name: compacted_log_segment_size

compaction_ctrl_backlog_size.description: target backlog size for compaction controller. if not set compaction target compaction backlog would be equal to
compaction_ctrl_backlog_size.name: compaction_ctrl_backlog_size

compaction_ctrl_d_coeff.description: derivative coefficient for compaction PID controller.
compaction_ctrl_d_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_d_coeff

compaction_ctrl_i_coeff.description: integral coefficient for compaction PID controller.
compaction_ctrl_i_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_i_coeff

compaction_ctrl_max_shares.description: maximum number of IO and CPU shares that compaction process can use
compaction_ctrl_max_shares.name: compaction_ctrl_max_shares

compaction_ctrl_min_shares.description: minimum number of IO and CPU shares that compaction process can use
compaction_ctrl_min_shares.name: compaction_ctrl_min_shares

compaction_ctrl_p_coeff.description: proportional coefficient for compaction PID controller. This has to be negative since compaction backlog should decrease when number of compaction shares increases
compaction_ctrl_p_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_p_coeff

consumer_instance_timeout.description: How long to wait for an idle consumer before removing it
consumer_instance_timeout.name: consumer_instance_timeout_ms

consumer_request_max_bytes.description: Max bytes to fetch per request
consumer_request_max_bytes.name: consumer_request_max_bytes

consumer_request_min_bytes.description: Min bytes to fetch per request
consumer_request_min_bytes.name: consumer_request_min_bytes

consumer_request_timeout.description: Interval (in milliseconds) for consumer request timeout
consumer_request_timeout.name: consumer_request_timeout_ms

controller_backend_housekeeping_interval.description: Interval between iterations of controller backend housekeeping loop
controller_backend_housekeeping_interval.name: controller_backend_housekeeping_interval_ms

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller acls and users operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_acls_and_users_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller configuration operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_configuration_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller move operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_move_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller node management operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_node_management_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller topic operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_topic_operations

controller_snapshot_max_age_sec.description: Max time that will pass before we make an attempt to create a controller snapshot, after a new controller command appears
controller_snapshot_max_age_sec.name: controller_snapshot_max_age_sec

The maximum number of functions that can be deployed to a cluster is equal to data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservation / data_transforms_per_function_memory_limit

data_transforms_runtime_limit_ms.name: data_transforms_runtime_limit_ms

data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_perc.description: The percentage of available memory in the transform subsystem to use for write buffers
data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_perc.name: data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_percentage

debug_load_slice_warning_depth.description: The recursion depth after which debug logging will be enabled automatically for the log reader.
debug_load_slice_warning_depth.name: debug_load_slice_warning_depth

default_num_windows.description: Default number of quota tracking windows

default_topic_partitions.name: default_topic_partitions

default_topic_replication.description: Default replication factor for new topics

default_window_sec.description: Default quota tracking window size in milliseconds
default_window_sec.name: default_window_sec

disable_batch_cache.description: Disable batch cache in log manager
disable_batch_cache.name: disable_batch_cache

disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests.description: Disables the cluster recovery loop. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests.name: disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests

disable_metrics.description: Disable registering metrics exposed on the internal metrics endpoint (/metrics)

disable_public_metrics.description: Disable registering metrics exposed on the public metrics endpoint (/public_metrics)
disable_public_metrics.name: disable_public_metrics

This applies both when cloud cache and log data share a disk, as well as when cloud cache uses a dedicated disk. It is recommended to not run disks near capacity to avoid blocking I/O due to low disk space, as well as avoiding performance issues associated with SSD garbage collection.

emergency_disable_data_transforms.description: Override the cluster enablement setting and disable WebAssembly powered data transforms. Only used as an emergency shutoff button.
emergency_disable_data_transforms.name: emergency_disable_data_transforms

empty_seed_starts_cluster.description: If true, an empty seed_servers list will denote that this node should form a cluster. At most one node in the cluster should be configured configured with an empty seed_servers list. If no such configured node exists, or if configured to false, all nodes denoted by the seed_servers list must be identical among those nodes' configurations, and those nodes will form the initial cluster.
empty_seed_starts_cluster.name: empty_seed_starts_cluster

enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add.description: Enable automatic partition rebalancing when new nodes are added
enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add.name: enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add

enable_cluster_metadata_upload_loop.name: enable_cluster_metadata_upload_loop

enable_controller_log_rate_limiting.description: Enables limiting of controller log write rate
enable_controller_log_rate_limiting.name: enable_controller_log_rate_limiting

enable_pid_file.description: Enable pid file. You probably don't want to change this.

enable_sasl.description: Enable SASL authentication for Kafka connections, authorization is required. see also `kafka_enable_authorization`

enable_schema_id_validation.description: Enable Server Side Schema ID Validation.

features_auto_enable.name: features_auto_enable

fetch_reads_debounce_timeout.description: Time to wait for next read in fetch request when requested min bytes wasn't reached
fetch_reads_debounce_timeout.name: fetch_reads_debounce_timeout

fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms.description: Minimum time before which unused session will get evicted from sessions. Maximum time after which inactive session will be deleted is two time given configuration valuecache
fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms.name: fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms

find_coordinator_timeout_ms.description: Time to wait for a response from tx_registry
find_coordinator_timeout_ms.name: find_coordinator_timeout_ms

fips_mode.description: Controls whether Redpanda starts in FIPS mode.  This property allows for three values: 'disabled', 'enabled', and 'permissive'.  With 'enabled', Redpanda first verifies that the operating system is enabled for FIPS by checking /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled.  If the file does not exist or does not return '1', Redpanda immediately exits.  With 'permissive', the same check is performed but a WARNING is logged and Redpanda continues to run.  After the check is complete, Redpanda loads the OpenSSL FIPS provider into the OpenSSL library.  After this is complete, Redpanda is operating in FIPS mode, which means that the TLS cipher suites available to users are limited to TLSv1.2 and TLSv1.3, and of those, only the ones that use NIST-approved cryptographic methods.  For more information about FIPS, refer to Redpanda documentation.
fips_mode.name: fips_mode

group_initial_rebalance_delay.description: Extra delay (ms) added to rebalance phase to wait for new members
group_initial_rebalance_delay.name: group_initial_rebalance_delay

group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers. Longer timeouts give consumers more time to process messages in between heartbeats at the cost of a longer time to detect failures.
group_max_session_timeout_ms.name: group_max_session_timeout_ms

group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers. Shorter timeouts result in quicker failure detection at the cost of more frequent consumer heartbeating, which can overwhelm broker resources.
group_min_session_timeout_ms.name: group_min_session_timeout_ms

group_offset_retention_check_ms.description: How often the system should check for expired group offsets.
group_offset_retention_check_ms.name: group_offset_retention_check_ms

group_offset_retention_sec.description: Consumer group offset retention seconds. Offset retention can be disabled by setting this value to null.
group_offset_retention_sec.name: group_offset_retention_sec

group_topic_partitions.name: group_topic_partitions

health_monitor_max_metadata_age.description: Max age of metadata cached in the health monitor of non controller node
health_monitor_max_metadata_age.name: health_monitor_max_metadata_age

health_monitor_tick_interval.description: How often health monitor refresh cluster state
health_monitor_tick_interval.name: health_monitor_tick_interval

initial_retention_local_target_bytes_def.name: initial_retention_local_target_bytes_default

initial_retention_local_target_ms_defaul.description: Initial local retention time target for partitions of topics with cloud storage write enabled. If no initial local target retention is configured all locally retained data will be delivered to learner when joining partition replica set
initial_retention_local_target_ms_defaul.name: initial_retention_local_target_ms_default

internal_topic_replication_factor.description: Target replication factor for internal topics
internal_topic_replication_factor.name: internal_topic_replication_factor

join_retry_timeout_ms.description: Time between cluster join retries in milliseconds
join_retry_timeout_ms.name: join_retry_timeout_ms

kafka_admin_topic_api_rate.description: Target quota rate (partition mutations per default_window_sec)
kafka_admin_topic_api_rate.name: kafka_admin_topic_api_rate

kafka_api.description: Address and port of an interface to listen for Kafka API requests
kafka_api.name: kafka_api

kafka_api_tls.description: TLS configuration for Kafka API endpoint
kafka_api_tls.name: kafka_api_tls

kafka_batch_max_bytes.description: Maximum size of a batch processed by server. If batch is compressed the limit applies to compressed batch size
kafka_batch_max_bytes.name: kafka_batch_max_bytes

kafka_client_group_byte_rate_quota.description: Per-group target produce quota byte rate (bytes per second). Client is considered part of the group if client_id contains clients_prefix
kafka_client_group_byte_rate_quota.name: kafka_client_group_byte_rate_quota

kafka_client_group_fetch_byte_rate_quota.description: Per-group target fetch quota byte rate (bytes per second). Client is considered part of the group if client_id contains clients_prefix
kafka_client_group_fetch_byte_rate_quota.name: kafka_client_group_fetch_byte_rate_quota

kafka_connection_rate_limit.description: Maximum connections per second for one core
kafka_connection_rate_limit.name: kafka_connection_rate_limit

kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides.description: Overrides for specific ips for maximum connections per second for one core
kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides.name: kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides

kafka_connections_max_overrides.name: kafka_connections_max_overrides

kafka_connections_max_per_ip.description: Maximum number of Kafka client connections from each IP address, per broker
kafka_connections_max_per_ip.name: kafka_connections_max_per_ip

kafka_enable_authorization.description: Enable authorization for Kafka connections. Values:- `nil`: Ignored. Authorization is enabled with `enable_sasl: true`; `true`: authorization is required; `false`: authorization is disabled. See also: `enable_sasl` and `kafka_api[].authentication_method`

kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_st.description: Whether to include tiered storage as a special remote:// directory in DescribeLogDirs Kafka API requests.
kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_st.name: kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_storage

kafka_enable_partition_reassignment.name: kafka_enable_partition_reassignment

kafka_group_recovery_timeout_ms.description: Kafka group recovery timeout expressed in milliseconds
kafka_group_recovery_timeout_ms.name: kafka_group_recovery_timeout_ms

kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch.description: Limit fetch responses to this many bytes, even if total of partition bytes limits is higher
kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch.name: kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch

kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fet.description: The size of the batch used to estimate memory consumption for Fetch requests, in bytes. Smaller sizes allow more concurrent fetch requests per shard, larger sizes prevent running out of memory because of too many concurrent fetch requests.
kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fet.name: kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fetch

kafka_memory_share_for_fetch.description: The share of kafka subsystem memory that can be used for fetch read buffers, as a fraction of kafka subsystem memory amount
kafka_memory_share_for_fetch.name: kafka_memory_share_for_fetch

kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules.description: Principal Mapping Rules for mTLS Authentication on the Kafka API
kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules.name: kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules

kafka_nodelete_topics.description: Prevents the topics in the list from being deleted via the kafka api

kafka_noproduce_topics.name: kafka_noproduce_topics

kafka_qdc_depth_alpha.description: Smoothing factor for kafka queue depth control depth tracking.

kafka_qdc_depth_update_ms.description: Update frequency for kafka queue depth control.

kafka_qdc_idle_depth.description: Queue depth when idleness is detected in kafka queue depth control.

kafka_qdc_latency_alpha.description: Smoothing parameter for kafka queue depth control latency tracking.

kafka_qdc_max_depth.description: Maximum queue depth used in kafka queue depth control.
kafka_qdc_max_depth.name: kafka_qdc_max_depth

kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms.description: Max latency threshold for kafka queue depth control depth tracking.
kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms.name: kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms

kafka_qdc_min_depth.description: Minimum queue depth used in kafka queue depth control.

kafka_qdc_window_count.description: Number of windows used in kafka queue depth control latency tracking.

kafka_qdc_window_size_ms.description: Window size for kafka queue depth control latency tracking.
kafka_qdc_window_size_ms.name: kafka_qdc_window_size_ms

kafka_quota_balancer_min_shard_throughpu.description: The lowest value of the throughput quota a shard can get in the process of quota balancing, in bytes/s. 0 means there is no minimum.

kafka_request_max_bytes.description: Maximum size of a single request processed via Kafka API
kafka_request_max_bytes.name: kafka_request_max_bytes

kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf.description: Userspace receive buffer max size in bytes
kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf.name: kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf

kafka_rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.description: Kafka server TCP receive buffer size in bytes.

kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.description: Kafka server TCP transmit buffer size in bytes.
kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.name: kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf

kafka_sasl_max_reauth_ms.description: The maximum time between Kafka client reauthentications. If a client has not reauthenticated a connection within this time frame, that connection is torn down. Without this, a connection could live long after the client's credentials are expired or revoked. Session expiry is disabled if the value is null.

kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacit.description: Per-shard capacity of the cache for validating schema IDs.
kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacit.name: kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacity

kafka_tcp_keepalive_idle_timeout_seconds.description: TCP keepalive idle timeout in seconds for kafka connections. This describes the timeout between tcp keepalive probes that the remote sitesuccessfully acknowledged. Refers to the TCP_KEEPIDLE socket option. When changed applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_idle_timeout_seconds.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_timeout

kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_secon.description: TCP keepalive probe interval in seconds for kafka connections. This describes the timeout between unacknowledged tcp keepalives. Refers to the TCP_KEEPINTVL socket option. When changed applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_secon.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_seconds

kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes.description: TCP keepalive unacknowledged probes until the connection is considered dead for kafka connections. Refers to the TCP_KEEPCNT socket option. When changed applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes

kafka_throughput_control.description: List of throughput control groups that define exclusions from node-wide throughput limits. Each group consists of: ("name" (optional) - any unique group name, "client_id" - regex to match client_id). A connection is assigned the first matching group, then the connection is excluded from throughput control.
kafka_throughput_control.name: kafka_throughput_control

kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys.description: List of Kafka API keys that are subject to cluster-wide and node-wide throughput limit control
kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys.name: kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys

kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps.description: Node wide throughput ingress limit - maximum kafka traffic throughput allowed on the ingress side of each node, in bytes/s. Default is no limit.
kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps.name: kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps

kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps.description: Node wide throughput egress limit - maximum kafka traffic throughput allowed on the egress side of each node, in bytes/s. Default is no limit.
kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps.name: kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps

kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold.description: Threshold for refilling the token bucket. Will be clamped between 1 and kafka_throughput_limit_node_*_bps.
kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold.name: kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold

kafka_throughput_throttling_v2.description: Use throughput throttling based on a shared token bucket instead of balancing quota between shards
kafka_throughput_throttling_v2.name: kafka_throughput_throttling_v2

leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard.description: Per shard limit for in progress leadership transfers
leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard.name: leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard

legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled.description: Group offset retention is enabled by default in versions of Redpanda >= 23.1. To enable offset retention after upgrading from an older version set this option to true.
legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled.name: legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled

legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation.description: Permits the use of strings that may induct log injection/modification
legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation.name: legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation

legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec.description: Interval, in seconds, of how often a message informing the operator that unsafe strings are permitted
legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec.name: legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec

log_compaction_interval_ms.description: How often do we trigger background compaction
log_compaction_interval_ms.name: log_compaction_interval_ms

log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests.description: Disables the housekeeping loop for local storage. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests.name: log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests

log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms.description: Threshold in milliseconds for alerting on messages with a timestamp after the broker's time, meaning they are in the future relative to the broker's clock.
log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms.name: log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms

log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms.description: Threshold in milliseconds for alerting on messages with a timestamp before the broker's time, meaning they are in the past relative to the broker's clock. null to disable this check
log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms.name: log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms

log_retention_ms.description: delete segments older than this - default 1 week
log_retention_ms.name: log_retention_ms

log_segment_ms.description: Default log segment lifetime in ms for topics which do not set segment.ms
log_segment_ms.name: log_segment_ms

log_segment_ms_max.description: Upper bound on topic segment.ms: higher values will be clamped to this value
log_segment_ms_max.name: log_segment_ms_max

log_segment_ms_min.description: Lower bound on topic segment.ms: lower values will be clamped to this value
log_segment_ms_min.name: log_segment_ms_min

log_segment_size.description: Default log segment size in bytes for topics which do not set segment.bytes
log_segment_size.name: log_segment_size

log_segment_size_jitter_percent.description: Random variation to the segment size limit used for each partition
log_segment_size_jitter_percent.name: log_segment_size_jitter_percent

log_segment_size_max.description: Upper bound on topic segment.bytes: higher values will be clamped to this limit
log_segment_size_max.name: log_segment_size_max

log_segment_size_min.description: Lower bound on topic segment.bytes: lower values will be clamped to this limit
log_segment_size_min.name: log_segment_size_min

lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled.description: Disable reusable preallocated buffers for LZ4 decompression
lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled.name: lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled

max_compacted_log_segment_size.description: Max compacted segment size after consolidation
max_compacted_log_segment_size.name: max_compacted_log_segment_size

max_concurrent_producer_ids.description: Max number of the active sessions (producers). When the threshold is passed Redpanda terminates old sessions. When an idle producer corresponding to the terminated session wakes up and produces - it leads to its batches being rejected with out of order sequence error.
max_concurrent_producer_ids.name: max_concurrent_producer_ids

max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_sh.description: Maximum number of in flight HTTP requests permitted in pandaproxy per shard.  Any additional requests above this limit will be rejected with a 429 error
max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_sh.name: max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_shard

max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_p.description: Maximum number of in flight HTTP requests permitted in schema registry per shard.  Any additional requests above this limit will be rejected with a 429 error
max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_p.name: max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_per_shard

max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms.description: Fail-safe maximum throttle delay on kafka requests
max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms.name: max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms

max_transactions_per_coordinator.description: Max number of the active txn sessions (producers). When the threshold is passed Redpanda terminates old sessions. When an idle producer corresponding to the terminated session wakes up and produces - it leads to its batches being rejected with invalid producer epoch or invalid_producer_id_mapping (it depends on the txn execution phase).
max_transactions_per_coordinator.name: max_transactions_per_coordinator

members_backend_retry_ms.description: Time between members backend reconciliation loop retries
members_backend_retry_ms.name: members_backend_retry_ms

memory_abort_on_alloc_failure.description: If true, the redpanda process will terminate immediately when an allocation cannot be satisfied due to memory exhaustion. If false, an exception is thrown instead.
