memory_allocation_warning_threshold.description: Enables log messages for allocations greater than the given size.
memory_allocation_warning_threshold.name: memory_allocation_warning_threshold

metadata_dissemination_retries.description: Number of attempts of looking up a topic's meta data like shard before failing a request
metadata_dissemination_retries.name: metadata_dissemination_retries

metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms.description: Delay before retry a topic lookup in a shard or other meta tables
metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms.name: metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms

metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time to wait in metadata request for cluster health to be refreshed
metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms.name: metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms

minimum_topic_replication.description: Minimum permitted value of replication factor for new topics
minimum_topic_replication.name: minimum_topic_replications

node_id.description: Unique id identifying a node in the cluster. If missing, a unique id will be assigned for this node when it joins the cluster
node_id.name: node_id

node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout.description: How long after the last heartbeat request a node will wait before considering itself to be isolated
node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout.name: node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout

node_management_operation_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for executing node management operations
node_management_operation_timeout_ms.name: node_management_operation_timeout_ms

node_status_interval.description: Time interval between two node status messages. Node status messages establish liveness status outside of the Raft protocol.
node_status_interval.name: node_status_interval

node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms.description: Maximum backoff (in ms) to reconnect to an unresponsive peer during node status liveness checks.
node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms.name: node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms

oidc_clock_skew_tolerance.description: The amount of seconds to allow for when validating the exp, nbf, and iat claims in the token.
oidc_clock_skew_tolerance.name: oidc_clock_skew_tolerance

oidc_discovery_url.description: The URL pointing to the well-known discovery endpoint for the OIDC provider.
oidc_discovery_url.name: oidc_discovery_url

oidc_keys_refresh_interval.description: The frequency of refreshing the JSON Web Keys (JWKS) used to validate access tokens.
oidc_keys_refresh_interval.name: oidc_keys_refresh_interval

oidc_principal_mapping.description: Rule for mapping JWT Payload claim to a Redpanda User Principal
oidc_principal_mapping.name: oidc_principal_mapping

oidc_token_audience.description: A string representing the intended recipient of the token.
oidc_token_audience.name: oidc_token_audience

openssl_config_file.description: Path to the configuration file used by OpenSSL to propertly load the FIPS-compliant module.
openssl_config_file.name: openssl_config_file

openssl_module_directory.description: Path to the directory that contains the OpenSSL FIPS-compliant module.
openssl_module_directory.name: openssl_module_directory

pandaproxy_api.description: Rest API listen address and port
pandaproxy_api.name: pandaproxy_api

partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves.description: Number of partitions that can be reassigned at once
partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves.name: partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves

partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_p.description: Disk usage threshold that triggers moving partitions from the node
partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_p.name: partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_percent

partition_autobalancing_min_size_thresho.description: Minimum size of partition that is going to be prioritized when rebalancing cluster due to disk size threshold being breached. By default this value is calculated automaticaly
partition_autobalancing_min_size_thresho.name: partition_autobalancing_min_size_threshold

partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_s.description: Total size of partitions that autobalancer is going to move in one batch (deprecated, use partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves to limit the autobalancer concurrency)
partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_s.name: partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_size_bytes

partition_autobalancing_node_availabilit.description: Node unavailability timeout that triggers moving partitions from the node
partition_autobalancing_node_availabilit.name: partition_autobalancing_node_availability_timeout_sec

partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_.description: If the number of scheduled tick moves drops by this ratio, a new tick is scheduled immediately. Valid values are (0, 1]. For example, with a value of 0.2 and 100 scheduled moves in a tick, a new tick is scheduled when the inprogress moves are < 80.
partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_.name: partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_threshold

partition_autobalancing_topic_aware.description: If true, Redpanda will prioritize balancing topic-wise number of partitions on each node, as opposed to balancing the total number of partitions. This should give better balancing results if topics with diverse partition sizes and load profiles are present in the cluster.
partition_autobalancing_topic_aware.name: partition_autobalancing_topic_aware

partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_time.description: A threshold value to detect partitions which shutdown might have been stuck. After this threshold a watchdog in partition manager will log information about partition shutdown not making progress
partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_time.name: partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_timeout

pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests.description: Maximum number of x-core requests pending in Panda Proxy and Schema Registry seastar::smp group.  (for more details look at `seastar::smp_service_group` documentation)
pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests.name: pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests

produce_ack_level.description: Number of acknowledgments the producer requires the leader to have received before considering a request complete, choices are 0, 1 and -1
produce_ack_level.name: produce_ack_level

produce_batch_delay.description: Delay (in milliseconds) to wait before sending batch
produce_batch_delay.name: produce_batch_delay_ms

produce_batch_record_count.description: Number of records to batch before sending to broker
produce_batch_record_count.name: produce_batch_record_count

produce_batch_size_bytes.description: Number of bytes to batch before sending to broker
produce_batch_size_bytes.name: produce_batch_size_bytes

produce_compression_type.description: Enable or disable compression by the kafka client. Specify 'none' to disable compression or one of the supported types [gzip, snappy, lz4, zstd]
produce_compression_type.name: produce_compression_type

produce_shutdown_delay.description: Delay (in milliseconds) to allow for final flush of buffers before shutting down
produce_shutdown_delay.name: produce_shutdown_delay_ms

quota_manager_gc_sec.description: Quota manager GC frequency in milliseconds
quota_manager_gc_sec.name: quota_manager_gc_sec

raft_enable_longest_log_detection.description: Enables additional step in leader election where candidate is allowed to wait for all the replies from node it requested votes from. This may introduce a small delay when recovering from failure but will prevent truncation if any of the replicas has more data than the majority.
raft_enable_longest_log_detection.name: raft_enable_longest_log_detection

raft_flush_timer_interval_ms.description: Interval of checking partition against the `raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes`, deprecated started 24.1, use raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms instead
raft_flush_timer_interval_ms.name: raft_flush_timer_interval_ms

raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures.description: After how many failed heartbeats to forcibly close an unresponsive TCP connection.  Set to 0 to disable force disconnection.
raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures.name: raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures

raft_learner_recovery_rate.description: Raft learner recovery rate limit in bytes per sec
raft_learner_recovery_rate.name: raft_learner_recovery_rate

raft_max_concurrent_append_requests_per_.description: Maximum number of concurrent append entries requests sent by leader to one follower
raft_max_concurrent_append_requests_per_.name: raft_max_concurrent_append_requests_per_follower

raft_max_recovery_memory.description: Max memory that can be used for reads in raft recovery process by default 15% of total memory
raft_max_recovery_memory.name: raft_max_recovery_memory

raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard.description: How many partitions may simultaneously recover data to a particular shard. This is limited to avoid overwhelming nodes when they come back online after an outage.
raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard.name: raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard

raft_recovery_default_read_size.description: default size of read issued during raft follower recovery
raft_recovery_default_read_size.name: raft_recovery_default_read_size

raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_m.description: Disables dynamic rate allocation in recovery throttle (advanced).
raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_m.name: raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_mode

raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms.description: Maximum delay (in ms) between two subsequent flushes. After this delay, the log will be automatically force flushed.
raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms.name: raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms

raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes.description: Max not flushed bytes per partition. If configured threshold is reached log will automatically be flushed even though it wasn't explicitly requested
raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes.name: raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes

raft_replicate_batch_window_size.description: Max size of requests cached for replication
raft_replicate_batch_window_size.name: raft_replicate_batch_window_size

raft_smp_max_non_local_requests.description: Maximum number of x-core requests pending in Raft seastar::smp group. (for more details look at `seastar::smp_service_group` documentation)
raft_smp_max_non_local_requests.name: raft_smp_max_non_local_requests

raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for a timeout now request
raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms.name: raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms

raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms.description: Timeout waiting for follower recovery when transferring leadership
raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms.name: raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms

readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms.description: Duration after which inactive readers will be evicted from cache
readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms.name: readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms

readers_cache_target_max_size.description: Maximum desired number of readers cached per ntp. This a soft limit, a number of readers in cache may temporary increase as cleanup is done in background
readers_cache_target_max_size.name: readers_cache_target_max_size

reclaim_batch_cache_min_free.description: Free memory limit that will be kept by batch cache background reclaimer
reclaim_batch_cache_min_free.name: reclaim_batch_cache_min_free

reclaim_growth_window.description: Length of time in which reclaim sizes grow
reclaim_growth_window.name: reclaim_growth_window

reclaim_stable_window.description: Length of time above which growth is reset
reclaim_stable_window.name: reclaim_stable_window

recovery_append_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for append entries requests issued while updating stale follower
recovery_append_timeout_ms.name: recovery_append_timeout_ms

recovery_mode_enabled.description: If true, start redpanda in "metadata only" mode, skipping loading user partitions and allowing only metadata operations.
recovery_mode_enabled.name: recovery_mode_enabled

replicate_append_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for append entries requests issued while replicating entries
replicate_append_timeout_ms.name: replicate_append_timeout_ms

retention_bytes.description: Default max bytes per partition on disk before triggering a compaction
retention_bytes.name: retention_bytes

retention_local_strict.description: Trim log data when a cloud topic reaches its local retention limit. When this option is disabled Redpanda will allow partitions to grow past the local retention limit, and will be trimmed automatically as storage reaches the configured target size.
retention_local_strict.name: retention_local_strict

retention_local_strict_override.description: Trim log data when a cloud topic reaches its local retention limit. When this option is disabled Redpanda will allow partitions to grow past the local retention limit, and will be trimmed automatically as storage reaches the configured target size.
retention_local_strict_override.name: retention_local_strict_override

retention_local_target_bytes_default.description: Local retention size target for partitions of topics with cloud storage write enabled
retention_local_target_bytes_default.name: retention_local_target_bytes_default

retention_local_target_capacity_bytes.description: The target capacity in bytes that log storage will try to use before additional retention rules will take over to trim data in order to meet the target. When no target is specified storage usage is unbounded.
retention_local_target_capacity_bytes.name: retention_local_target_capacity_bytes

retention_local_target_capacity_percent.description: The target capacity in percent of unreserved space (see disk_reservation_percent) that log storage will try to use before additional retention rules will take over to trim data in order to meet the target. When no target is specified storage usage is unbounded.
retention_local_target_capacity_percent.name: retention_local_target_capacity_percent

retention_local_target_ms_default.description: Local retention time target for partitions of topics with cloud storage write enabled
retention_local_target_ms_default.name: retention_local_target_ms_default

retention_local_trim_interval.description: The maximum amount of time before log storage will examine usage to determine of the target capacity has been exceeded and additional data trimming is required.
retention_local_trim_interval.name: retention_local_trim_interval

retention_local_trim_overage_coeff.description: The space management control loop will reclaim the overage multiplied by this this coefficient in order to compensate for data that is written during the idle period between control loop invocations.
retention_local_trim_overage_coeff.name: retention_local_trim_overage_coeff

retries.description: Number of times to retry a request to a broker
retries.name: retries

retry_base_backoff.description: Delay (in milliseconds) for initial retry backoff
retry_base_backoff.name: retry_base_backoff_ms

rm_sync_timeout_ms.description: Time to wait state catch up before rejecting a request
rm_sync_timeout_ms.name: rm_sync_timeout_ms

rpc_client_connections_per_peer.description: The maximum number of connections a broker will open to each of its peers
rpc_client_connections_per_peer.name: rpc_client_connections_per_peer

rpc_server.description: IpAddress and port for RPC server
rpc_server.name: rpc_server

rpc_server_compress_replies.description: Enable compression for internal rpc server replies
rpc_server_compress_replies.name: rpc_server_compress_replies

rpc_server_listen_backlog.description: TCP connection queue length for Kafka server and internal RPC server
rpc_server_listen_backlog.name: rpc_server_listen_backlog

rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.description: Internal RPC TCP receive buffer size in bytes.
rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.name: rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf

rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.description: Internal RPC TCP transmit buffer size in bytes.
rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.name: rpc_server_tcp_send_buf

rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations.description: Rate limit for controller acls and users operations
rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations.name: rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations

rps_limit_configuration_operations.description: Rate limit for controller configuration operations
rps_limit_configuration_operations.name: rps_limit_configuration_operations

rps_limit_move_operations.description: Rate limit for controller move operations
rps_limit_move_operations.name: rps_limit_move_operations

rps_limit_node_management_operations.description: Rate limit for controller node management operations
rps_limit_node_management_operations.name: rps_limit_node_management_operations

rps_limit_topic_operations.description: Rate limit for controller topic operations
rps_limit_topic_operations.name: rps_limit_topic_operations

sampled_memory_profile.description: If true, memory allocations will be sampled and tracked. A sampled live set of allocations can then be retrieved from the Admin API. Additionally, we will periodically log the top-n allocation sites
sampled_memory_profile.name: memory_enable_memory_sampling

sasl_kerberos_config.description: The location of the Kerberos krb5.conf file for Redpanda
sasl_kerberos_config.name: sasl_kerberos_config

sasl_kerberos_keytab.description: The location of the Kerberos keytab file for Redpanda
sasl_kerberos_keytab.name: sasl_kerberos_keytab

sasl_kerberos_principal.description: The primary of the Kerberos Service Principal Name (SPN) for Redpanda
sasl_kerberos_principal.name: sasl_kerberos_principal

sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping.description: Rules for mapping Kerberos Principal Names to Redpanda User Principals
sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping.name: sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping

sasl_mechanism.description: The SASL mechanism to use when connecting
sasl_mechanism.name: sasl_mechanism

sasl_mechanisms.description: A list of supported SASL mechanisms. `SCRAM`, `GSSAPI`, and `OAUTHBEARER` are allowed.
sasl_mechanisms.name: sasl_mechanisms

schema_registry_api.description: Schema Registry API listen address and port
schema_registry_api.name: schema_registry_api

schema_registry_api_tls.description: TLS configuration for Schema Registry API
schema_registry_api_tls.name: schema_registry_api_tls

schema_registry_replication_factor.description: Replication factor for internal _schemas topic.  If unset, defaults to `default_topic_replication`
schema_registry_replication_factor.name: schema_registry_replication_factor

scram_password.description: Password to use for SCRAM authentication mechanisms
scram_password.name: scram_password

scram_username.description: Username to use for SCRAM authentication mechanisms
scram_username.name: scram_username

seed_servers.description: List of the seed servers used to join current cluster. If the seed_server list is empty the node will be a cluster root and it will form a new cluster
seed_servers.name: seed_servers

segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms.description: Maximum delay until buffered data is written
segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms.name: segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms

space_management_enable_override.description: Enable automatic space management. This option is ignored and deprecated in versions >= v23.3.
space_management_enable_override.name: space_management_enable_override

space_management_max_log_concurrency.description: Maximum parallel logs inspected during space management process.
space_management_max_log_concurrency.name: space_management_max_log_concurrency

space_management_max_segment_concurrency.description: Maximum parallel segments inspected during space management process.
space_management_max_segment_concurrency.name: space_management_max_segment_concurrency

storage_compaction_index_memory.description: Maximum number of bytes that may be used on each shard by compactionindex writers
storage_compaction_index_memory.name: storage_compaction_index_memory

storage_compaction_key_map_memory.description: Maximum number of bytes that may be used on each shard by compaction key-offset maps. Only respected when `log_compaction_use_sliding_window` is true.
storage_compaction_key_map_memory.name: storage_compaction_key_map_memory

storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_.description: Limit on `storage_compaction_key_map_memory`, expressed as a percentage of memory per shard, that bounds the amount of memory used by compaction key-offset maps. NOTE: Memory per shard is computed after `wasm_per_core_memory_reservation`. Only respected when `log_compaction_use_sliding_window` is true.
storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_.name: storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_percent

storage_failure_injection_config_path.description: Path to the configuration file used for low level storage failure injection
storage_failure_injection_config_path.name: storage_failure_injection_config_path

storage_failure_injection_enabled.description: If true, inject low level storage failures on the write path. **Not** for production usage.
storage_failure_injection_enabled.name: storage_failure_injection_enabled

storage_ignore_cstore_hints.description: if set, cstore hints will be ignored and will not be used for data access (but will otherwise be generated)
storage_ignore_cstore_hints.name: storage_ignore_cstore_hints

storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec.description: If set, timestamps more than this many seconds in the future relative tothe server's clock will be ignored for data retention purposes, and retention will act based on another timestamp in the same segment, or the mtime of the segment file if no valid timestamp is available
storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec.name: storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec

storage_max_concurrent_replay.description: Maximum number of partitions' logs that will be replayed concurrently at startup, or flushed concurrently on shutdown.
storage_max_concurrent_replay.name: storage_max_concurrent_replay

storage_min_free_bytes.description: Threshold of minimum bytes free space before rejecting producers.
storage_min_free_bytes.name: storage_min_free_bytes

storage_read_buffer_size.description: Size of each read buffer (one per in-flight read, per log segment)
storage_read_buffer_size.name: storage_read_buffer_size

storage_read_readahead_count.description: How many additional reads to issue ahead of current read location
storage_read_readahead_count.name: storage_read_readahead_count

storage_reserve_min_segments.description: The number of segments per partition that the system will attempt to reserve disk capacity for. For example, if the maximum segment size is configured to be 100 MB, and the value of this option is 2, then in a system with 10 partitions Redpanda will attempt to reserve at least 2 GB of disk space.
storage_reserve_min_segments.name: storage_reserve_min_segments

storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes.description: Threshold of minimum bytes free space before setting storage space alert
storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes.name: storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes

storage_space_alert_free_threshold_perce.description: Threshold of minimum percent free space before setting storage space alert
storage_space_alert_free_threshold_perce.name: storage_space_alert_free_threshold_percent

storage_strict_data_init.description: Requires that an empty file named `.redpanda_data_dir` be present in the data directory. Redpanda will refuse to start if it is not found.
storage_strict_data_init.name: storage_strict_data_init

storage_target_replay_bytes.description: Target bytes to replay from disk on startup after clean shutdown: controls frequency of snapshots and checkpoints
storage_target_replay_bytes.name: storage_target_replay_bytes

target_fetch_quota_byte_rate.description: Target fetch size quota byte rate (bytes per second) - disabled default
target_fetch_quota_byte_rate.name: target_fetch_quota_byte_rate

target_quota_byte_rate.description: Target request size quota byte rate (bytes per second) - 2GB default
target_quota_byte_rate.name: target_quota_byte_rate

tm_sync_timeout_ms.description: Time to wait state catch up before rejecting a request
tm_sync_timeout_ms.name: tm_sync_timeout_ms

topic_fds_per_partition.description: Required file handles per partition when creating topics
topic_fds_per_partition.name: topic_fds_per_partition

topic_memory_per_partition.description: Required memory per partition when creating topics
topic_memory_per_partition.name: topic_memory_per_partition

topic_partitions_per_shard.description: Maximum number of partitions which may be allocated to one shard (CPU core)
topic_partitions_per_shard.name: topic_partitions_per_shard

topic_partitions_reserve_shard0.description: Reserved partition slots on shard (CPU core) 0 on each node.  If this is >= topic_partitions_per_core, no data partitions will be scheduled on shard 0
topic_partitions_reserve_shard0.name: topic_partitions_reserve_shard0

transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy.description: Cleanup policy for a transaction coordinator topic
transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy.name: transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy

transaction_coordinator_delete_retention.description: delete segments older than this - default 1 week
transaction_coordinator_delete_retention.name: transaction_coordinator_delete_retention_ms

transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size.description: How large in bytes should each log segment be (default 1G)
transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size.name: transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size

transaction_coordinator_partitions.description: Amount of partitions for transactions coordinator
transaction_coordinator_partitions.name: transaction_coordinator_partitions

transactional_id_expiration_ms.description: Producer ids are expired once this time has elapsed after the last write with the given producer id.
transactional_id_expiration_ms.name: transactional_id_expiration_ms

tx_log_stats_interval_s.description: How often to log per partition tx stats, works only with debug logging enabled.
tx_log_stats_interval_s.name: tx_log_stats_interval_s

tx_timeout_delay_ms.description: Delay before scheduling next check for timed out transactions
tx_timeout_delay_ms.name: tx_timeout_delay_ms

unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_re.description: Enables delete retention of consumer offsets topic. This is an internal-only configuration and should be enabled only after consulting with Redpanda Support or engineers.
unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_re.name: unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_retention

upgrade_override_checks.description: Whether to violate safety checks when starting a redpanda version newer than the cluster's consensus version
upgrade_override_checks.name: upgrade_override_checks

usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec.description: The interval in which all usage stats are written to disk
usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec.name: usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec

usage_num_windows.description: The number of windows to persist in memory and disk
usage_num_windows.name: usage_num_windows

usage_window_width_interval_sec.description: The width of a usage window, tracking cloud and kafka ingress/egress traffic each interval
usage_window_width_interval_sec.name: usage_window_width_interval_sec

use_fetch_scheduler_group.description: Use a separate scheduler group for fetch processing
use_fetch_scheduler_group.name: use_fetch_scheduler_group

verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max.description: Maximum duration in seconds for verbose (i.e. TRACE or DEBUG) logging. Values configured above this will be clamped. If null (the default) there is no limit. Can be overridded in the Admin API on a per-request basis.
verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max.name: verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max

virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids.description: Minimum number of active producers per virtual cluster
virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids.name: virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids

wait_for_leader_timeout_ms.description: Timeout (ms) to wait for leadership in metadata cache
wait_for_leader_timeout_ms.name: wait_for_leader_timeout_ms

write_caching_default.description: Cache batches until the segment appender chunk is full instead of flushing for every acks=all write. This is the global default for all topics and can be overriden at a topic scope with property write.caching. 'disabled' mode takes precedence over topic overrides and disables the feature altogether for the entire cluster.
write_caching_default.name: write_caching_default

zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes.description: Size of the zstd decompression workspace
zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes.name: zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes
